Comments_List: This class is a wonderful basis for further acting, both in the classroom and on stage.
I learned Uta Hagen's way of acting, how to be immediate, give and take with scene partner, develop inner objects, develop a superobjective and a through-line, substitution, etc.

I am not sure what the goal of the class was because it often seemed as though we were just learning to act in one specific way, not about any particular performance concepts. Most of the class had minimal experience with acting and were more interested in the technical side of theater and this class was not at all geared towards this side of theater.
There is a lot of individual feedback on every performance and every assignment.
everything about this course is phenomenal: the professor, the students, the methodology, even the space we were allowed to play in. It's truly a one-of-a-kind course.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student.

Yes! Take this class. Professor Dorfman is a marvel. You will learn so much about yourself through playing these characters. In fact, acting in certain scenes was a catharsis for me at the time, and helped me through rough times. You will develop confidence in yourself as an actor.
I would recommend it to theater majors or those interested in acting. It's a really helpful class with acting and general knowledge of theater, it was a great time, and Toni is wonderful.
